headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Applied Digital, RTX, Northrop Grumman
summary: ↗️ RTX (RTX), Northrop Grumman (NOC): Defense stocks rallied premarket after President Trump called for a $1.5 trillion defense budget. Shares in U.S. weapons manufacturers fell Wednesday after Trump lashed out at them and threatened to cancel RTX's Pentagon contracts.

headline: Stocks Slip Before the Open as Investors Weigh Trump Policy Shifts, U.S. Economic Data on Tap
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are down -0.19%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are down -0.28% this morning, pointing to further losses on Wall Street as investors digest a flurry of announcements from U.S. President Donald Trump on the U.S. housing and defense industries.

content.title: Stocks Slip Before the Open as Investors Weigh Trump Policy Shifts, U.S. Economic Data on Tap
content.summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are down -0.19%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are down -0.28% this morning, pointing to further losses on Wall Street as investors digest a flurry of announcements from U.S. President Donald Trump on the U.S. housing and defense industries.

headline: Nvidia in China, Constellation Brands & Applied Digital earnings
summary: Nvidia (NVDA), Constellation Brands (STZ), and Applied Digital (APLD) are some of the trending tickers on Yahoo Finance's platform on Thursday. Morning Brief host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Data and Markets Editor Jared Blikre examine the stories driving investor interest in the stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
